# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = []
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, join(lines, "\n")))
            lines = [word]
        else
            if !isempty(lines) && (endof(last(lines))) != '(')
                push!(lines, last(lines) * " " * word)
            else
                push!(lines, word)
            end
        end
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n"))
end

example_text = "This function will wrap words into lines based on a given text width"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(example_text)

println(wrapped_text)
```

The output of the code would be:

```
This function will wrap words into lines
based on a given text width
```
